catalog_info.title: Nonlinear Dynamical Systems
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Mathematics 21a and 21b, or Applied Mathematics 21a and 21b.
catalog_info.description: An introduction to nonlinear dynamical phenomena, covering the behavior of systems described by ordinary differential equations. Topics include: stability; bifurcations; chaos; routes to chaos and universality; approximations by maps; strange attractors; fractals. Techniques for analyzing nonlinear systems are introduced with applications to physical, chemical, and biological systems such as forced oscillators, chaotic reactions, and population dynamics.
